comments:
I was messing around with a PDE project (migrating to 3.1 among other things)
and wanted to recreate the build.xml file.

So, I backed up my build.xml file and deleted it.  I right-clicked the
plugin.xml file and selected "Create Ant Build File".  In doing this, I got an
error dialog that said "Unable to write script /home/ewies/project/build.xml". 
When I did "touch build.xml" to create a dummy file (to test permissions, or
something), the command completed without an error, but the resulting build
script was empty.

After looking at the stack trace in the error log, I saw which plugin and dove
into the CVS source.  It ended up that I had the "custom" flag set in my
build.properties file.  I had some custom ant commands in my project and had
forgotten that the flag was set.

I deleted build.xml again and removed the flag and all worked fine.

To make a long story short, I had to do some digging around to figure out what
was wrong.  A more verbose error message would be useful.  There is already an
error dialog for this specific failure mode  (see the callstack below), it just
needs to be more verbose -- something akin to "Could not open /path/build.xml
while updating project with custom build enabled."?

Cheers,
Evan
